title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: By 2022, child development and pre-school education institutions offer relevant services for children and their families, with coordination mechanisms, quality standards and programs to support institutional capacity-building., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Early Childhood Development, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, the most vulnerable and excluded children and adolescents have access to, remain and complete their early childhood development and pre-school and secondary education responding to their needs, potential and intercultural contexts.

related-activity.ref: 1020/A0/06/001 INCLUSIVE EARLY CHILDHOOD DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, child development and pre-school education institutions offer relevant services for children and their families, withcoordination mechanisms, quality standards and programs to support institutional capacity-building.

description.narrative: UNICEF contributed to the country’s childcare and integrated development system (REDCUDI), benefitting 61,691 children,;consolidating it from emerging to established. Together with ST-REDCUDI, it worked in three development areas:;building staff capacity, and promoting parenting skills and improved and expanded;communication. The system now has quality standards, an M&E framework, a georeferenced service information system, quality assessment tools, official school certification, peace manuals for Children&39;s Centers for Integral Development (CIDAI) of the National Child Welfare Agency (PANI), extramural and evening Education and Nutrition Centers and Children&39;s Centers for Comprehensive Children&39;s Care (CEN-CINAI) services, and an analysis of;Mixed Social Assistance Institute;(IMAS);Crecemos and Avancemos programs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:20/01/2022

title.narrative: Percentage of children attended by the Childcare Network.(57727)
Percentage of children between the age of 4.3 and 6.3 in pre-school education.(57725)
Country using the ECD Index (MICS) to report on SDG target 4.2.1 (early childhood development) (21-08-L3-02), Text

baseline.value: The ECD obtained in the 2011 survey was used in the development of the National Early Childhood Policy

target.value: 2022:Through a proxy index in 2022, the baseline of the policy can be tracked.

actual.value: 2021:The Index was developed by EMNA survey in 2018 and SDG target 4.2.1 will be reported.

title.narrative: Action Plan of the National Early Childhood Development Policy in execution, with an intersectoral approach and defined quality standards.(57728)

baseline.value: The National Early Childhood DevelopmentPolicy 2015-2020, approved on March 22, 2017, does not yet have an Action Plan

target.value: 2019:Action Plan approved and in execution by 2019.

actual.value: 2019:UNICEF has had a meeting with PANI to review their Work Plan, and PANI has defined the focal point for the reactivation of the Interinstitutional Commission for the generation of the Early Childhood Policy Action Plan. This action will start the activitie
